author: Staff
title: Hill seeks re-election as assessor
text:
Hill seeks re-election as assessor Posted: October 17, 2015 - 9:30pm Photos LOG CABIN DEMOCRAT 
Faulkner County Assessor Angela Hill announced she will seek re-election to a third term as assessor. “I am grateful to the citizens of Faulkner County for allowing me to serve as Assessor,” Hill said in a statement. “If the voters give me the opportunity to continue as assessor, I will use my years of experience to keep the office moving forward to better serve the citizens of Faulkner County. During my first term, I implemented online assessing of personal property ( www.faulknercounty.org/assessor ). 
“I have also made other changes within the office to improve efficiency. As the laws of the state of Arkansas change, I will make upgrades where necessary in the most effective and affordable way possible. I will be open to public input and questions and will strive to ensure that the office operates in a professional and friendly manner.” 
Hill has worked for the Faulkner County Assessor’s office for 27 years, with 20 years as Chief Deputy Assessor. 
She has been qualified as a level four senior appraiser by the state of Arkansas since 1990; was in charge of organizing the GIS Department for the office; was named Outstanding Assessor for 2014 by the Arkansas Chapter IAAO (International Association of Assessing Officers); serves on the Association of Arkansas Counties Board of Directors; is a member of IAAO and the Arkansas Assessor’s Association; and serves on the committee of the Nursing Home Gift Fund of Faulkner County, Inc. 
Hill and her husband of 29 years, Jimmy, have two daughters, Ashlie and Amber. She is a member of Oak Bowery Baptist Church.
